derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the general sense 'tending to make complete'): from medieval Latin perfectivus, from Latin perfectus 'accomplished' (see perfect)

means.word_mean: 1. a tense of verbs used in describing action that has been completed (sometimes regarded as perfective aspect)
2. the aspect of a verb that expresses a completed completed action
